item.title: Kristie add a quote by Sue Monk Kidd
item.description: "I wanted to know what happened when two people felt it. Would it divide the hurt in two, make it lighter to bear, the way feeling someone's joy seemed to double it?" -- Sue Monk Kidd

item.title: Kristie add a quote by Donald Miller
item.description: "...sometimes you have to watch somebody love something before you can love it yourself..." -- Donald Miller

item.title: Kristie add a quote by Yann Martel
item.description: "I ask you, is it the fig tree's fault that it's not the season for figs? What kind of thing is that to do to an innocent tree, wither it instantly?" -- Yann Martel

item.title: Kristie add a quote by Ann Brashares
item.description: "Particularly beautiful people were like particularly funny-looking people, though. Once you know them you mostly forgot about it." -- Ann Brashares

item.title: Kristie add a quote by Sue Monk Kidd
item.description: "We are so limited, you have to use the same word for loving Rosaleen as you do for loving Coke with peanuts. Isn't that a shame we don't have many more ways to say it?" -- Sue Monk Kidd

item.title: Kristie add a quote by Anita Diamant
item.description: "I wanted to cry, but I realized that I was too old for that. I would be a woman soon and I would have to learn how to live with a divided heart." -- Anita Diamant

item.title: Kristie add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "Oh, I get it," I said. "It's a parable. Cute. Let's go eat." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Kristie add a quote by Sue Monk Kidd
item.description: "some things don't matter much. Like the color of a house. How big is that in the overall scheme of life? But lifting a person's heart--now, that matters. The whole problem with people is...they know what matters, but they don't choose it...The hardest thing on earth is choosing what matters." -- Sue Monk Kidd

item.title: Kristie add a quote by Yann Martel
item.description: "If Christ spent an anguished night in prayer, if He burst out from the Cross, 'My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?' then surely we are also permitted doubt. But we must move on. To choose doubt as a philosophy of life is akin to choosing immobility as a means of transportation." -- Yann Martel

item.title: Kristie add a quote by Ann Brashares
item.description: "She used to cry roughly three times a year. Now she seemed to cry three times before breakfast. Could that be considered progress?" -- Ann Brashares

item.title: Kristie add a quote by Diane Setterfield
item.description: "A birth is not really a beginning. Our lives at the start are not really our own but only the continuation of someone else's story." -- Diane Setterfield

item.title: Kristie add a quote by Sue Monk Kidd
item.description: "It was the first time I'd ever said the words to another person, and the sound of them broke open my heart." -- Sue Monk Kidd

item.title: Kristie add a quote by Alan Alda
item.description: "At times you have to leave the city of your comfort and go into the wilderness of your intuition. What you'll discover will be wonderful. What you'll discover is yourself." -- Alan Alda

item.title: Kristie add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Kristie add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Kristie add a quote by Gary D. Schmidt
item.description: "It means, Doug Swieteck, that in this class, you are not your brother." -- Gary D. Schmidt

item.title: Kristie add a quote by Gary D. Schmidt
item.description: "In English, we were still on the Introduction to Poetry Unit, and I'm not lying, if I ever meet Percy Bysshe Shelley walking down the streets of Marysville, I'm going to punch him right in the face." -- Gary D. Schmidt
